summary: A character reference letter written to Judge Alison J. Nathan in November 2020, advocating for Ghislaine Maxwell's release on bail. The author, who identifies as a trustee of Maxwell's charity Terramar, describes a long-standing friendship, vouches for her character, and offers to provide financial surety.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York to whom this character reference letter for Ghislaine Maxwell is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the character reference letter. The author defends her character, denies she is a danger to children, and argues for her immediate release on bail to prepare her defense.

persons.name: Robert Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as the father of Ghislaine Maxwell and a close personal friend of the author's grandfather.

persons.name: Jack
persons.context: The author's grandfather, who was a close personal friend of Robert Maxwell.

persons.name: Mila
persons.context: The author's nearly 5-year-old daughter, who is said to adore Ghislaine Maxwell. The author states they would have no hesitation allowing Maxwell to look after her.

persons.name: Lyons
persons.context: The individual writing the character reference for Ghislaine Maxwell. Identifies as a trustee of her charity Terramar, a long-time friend, and offers to provide financial surety for her bail.

connections.description: Close friends since around 2002; the author socializes regularly with Maxwell, attended her 50th birthday, and is a trustee of her charity.
Connected through family; the author's grandfather (Jack) was a close personal friend of Robert Maxwell.
Lyons is the parent of Mila, who adores Ghislaine Maxwell.
The author states their daughter Mila adores Maxwell and they would trust Maxwell to look after her.

events.title: First meeting between Lyons and Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The author first met Ghislaine Maxwell through a mutual friend at a dinner in Los Angeles.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's 50th Birthday Party
events.description: The author attended Maxwell's 50th birthday party held at the Dorchester Hotel in London.

events.title: Submission of Character Reference for Bail Hearing
events.description: Lyons writes and submits this character reference letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan for Ghislaine Maxwell's upcoming bail hearing.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The author, Lyons, offers to provide financial surety to meet any bail pledge the court sets for Ghislaine Maxwell.
The author strongly disputes the charges, stating the U.S. should not think Maxwell poses a danger to children and would trust her with their own daughter.
The letter reveals Maxwell formed a charity named Terramar, focused on protecting the world's oceans, for which the author served as a trustee.
The author claims Maxwell has faced 'monstrous allegations in the press' that forced her to worry about her safety.
The letter is presented as an unsolicited character reference; the author states they are not paid or retained to provide it.
